results.title: The Grizzlies
results.brief_description: Monster of the imagination and monarch of the wild, the great grizzly bear has long played a part in myth and legend. Despite man’s combined fear of and fascination with the grizzly, the bear survives today only by consent of his one real contender - man. Travel from Alaska’s Brooks Range to Wyoming’s Yellowstone National Park for an illuminating portrait of this powerful, intelligent and extremely aggressive creature.

results.title: The Grinch
results.creator_credit: Universal Studios, Brian Grazer and Ron Howard
results.brief_description: In Whoville, the Whos are overexcited, preparing for both Christmas, and the town’s ‘Whobelation’, a celebration of everything ‘Who’. The Grinch (Jim Carrey), living on Mount Crumpet overlooking the town of Whoville, despises everything about the holiday season and the town (due to a bad childhood Christmas experience) and decides to stop the festive season all together. Meanwhile, down in Whoville little Cindy Lou Who is trying to discover the true meaning behind Christmas and believes the Grinch might have the answers. A live-action adaptation of Dr. Seuss’s Christmas classic ‘How the Grinch Stole Christmas’, narrated by Anthony Hopkins. Cast also includes Molly Shannon, Christine Baranski, Bill Irwin and Jeffrey Tambor.

results.title: The Grifters
results.creator_credit: Cineplex Odeon Films, Martin Scorsese, Robert A. Harris, Jim Painten and Stephen Frears
results.brief_description: Set in the sleazy horse-tracks and gambling dens of contemporary L.A., “The Grifters” is a modern crime film that compares favourably to classic Hollywood film-noir films. Based on Jim Thompson’s pulp classic of the same name, this film shimmers with a consistent erotic tension. John Cusack is Roy, a young con-man who makes easy money off the gullible hordes that crowd Los Angeles. He finds himself caught in the middle of a dangerous tug-of-war between his prostitute girlfriend (Annette Bening) who wants him to committ a major scam, and his elegant but desperate mother, Lily (Angelica Huston), who has been hustling for years and wants to find a way out. Both are powerful women not adverse to using the people they love to get what they want, and their desperate machinations to achieve financial independance puts Roy’s very life at risk. This brilliantly directed film is a powerful study on the corrosive effects of power and money on human relationships. All the cast is outstanding but special mention must be made of the majestic Angelica Huston: her blazing and frightening performance as Lily is unforgettable.

results.title: The Grievance hearing
results.creator_credit: Academy Productions, Edward L. Gershman and Art Babbitt
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personnel Management”.
A case study of a grievance, to show how hearings are conducted, what their purposes are and how a willingness to compromise can settle most disputes. In the case shows, a worker out sick for several weeks, has forgotten to notify the company formally of her illness. Under the collective bargaining contract this constitutes an “automatic quit”. Wen the worker returns she finds that her job has been filled. On the basis of her good working record, her three years’ seniority , and the nature of her illness - an operation that prevented her from calling in - the Sop Steward files a grievance. A hearing is held, attended by the Committee Chairman and other members of the Union, the Manager, a Personnel Man, and Mary, the worker. The Company agrees to re-hire Mary, placing her where they can find room; the union agrees that this will not constitute a precedent.

results.title: The Grievance
results.brief_description: This film illustrates the orderly processing of a grievance though several stages of negotiation between union and management, showing how the right of a worker with a genuine grievance are protected under the union’s contract. It shows the case of an unto-worker who was demoted for refusing to work inside a truck cab he considered too hot. The union registers the case as a legitimate grievance; it passes through three stages of negotiation in the plant, and eventually reaches an impartial arbitrator for the settlement.

results.title: The Greta Swamp
results.creator_credit: ACMI, ACMI Content Development, Shelley Matulick and Csilla Csongvay
results.brief_description: The area surrounding Greta, in north-eastern Victoria, used to be a swamp, home to indigenous wildlife and the mythical Bunyip creature. The swamp was drained as part of a government employment project in the 1890s, leaving behind rich fertile land ideal for grazing, however it also created a complete change in the area around Greta, especially in the hill country, causing environmental damage. One hundred years on and local Land Care members Anthony and David Griffiths, along with 2012 Land Care President Phil Gottschling, have dedicated their time and energy to try and reverse the effects of the dredging and are revegetating their land to restore balance to the environment.

results.title: The Greta Bunyip Newsletter
results.creator_credit: ACMI, ACMI Content Development, Shelley Matulick and Csilla Csongvay
results.brief_description: In the digital age it’s all well and good for those who are connected via high speed internet, but in some rural towns it is the good old fashioned newsletter that keeps locals in the know. The Bunyip Newsletter is hand-delivered across the wider Greta area by six committed volunteers. We meet Noeleen Lloyd and Allan Porker as well as local historian Joan Ellis and hear about the importance of having a local newsletter. ‘The Bunyip’ was born out of a demand from the locals to be better informed and more connected to their community and surrounds. Over 300 newsletters are distributed every two months containing articles of historical, sporting and community importance.
